summary: Janet Reno  was the United States Attorney General from 1993 to 2001, under President Bill Clinton.
full_text: Janet Wood Reno  served as the Attorney General of the United States, from 1993 to 2001. She was nominated by President Bill Clinton on February 11, 1993, and confirmed on March 11, 1993. She was the first woman to serve as Attorney General and the second longest serving Attorney General after William Wirt.
title: Janet Reno
